qas.question: When were plans for city expansion drawn?

context: The <a1_0>public water supply network<a1_0/> was completed in 1850, and in <a0_0>1858<a0_0/> the architects Sebastián Monleón Estellés, Antonino Sancho, and Timoteo Calvo drafted a general expansion project for the city that included demolishing its ancient walls (a second version was printed in 1868). Neither proposed project received final approval, but they did serve as a guide, though not closely followed, for future growth. By 1860 the municipality had <a4_0>140,416<a4_0/> inhabitants, and beginning in 1866 the ancient <a3_0>city walls<a3_0/> were almost entirely demolished to facilitate urban expansion. Electricity was introduced to Valencia in <a2_0>1882<a2_0/>.
